properties.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 1 at 7:17AM MST by NWS Pocatello ID
properties.description:
THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE FOREST
SERVICE SAWTOOTH AVALANCHE CENTER.

THE FOREST SERVICE SAWTOOTH AVALANCHE CENTER IN KETCHUM HAS
ISSUED A BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING.

* TIMING...IN EFFECT FROM NOW UNTIL 6 AM MST THURSDAY.

* AFFECTED AREA...THE SAWTOOTH, WESTERN SMOKY, AND SOUTHERN SALMON
MOUNTAINS, INCLUDING THE MOUNTAINS AROUND BANNER SUMMIT AND
THOSE NEAR STANLEY AND SMILEY CREEK. THE BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE
WARNING DOES NOT APPLY TO HIGHWAY AVALANCHE PROGRAMS OR
OPERATING SKI AREAS.

* AVALANCHE DANGER...HIGH FOR THE WARNING AREA.

* REASON/IMPACTS...HEAVY SNOW AND WIND ARE COMBINING TO OVERLOAD A
WEAK SNOWPACK. WIDESPREAD AVALANCHING WILL OCCUR.
properties.instruction:
BACKCOUNTRY TRAVELERS SHOULD STAY OFF OF...AND OUT FROM
UNDERNEATH...SLOPES STEEPER THAN 30 DEGREES.

AVALANCHES MAY RUN LONG DISTANCES AND CAN RUN INTO MATURE
FORESTS.

CONSULT WWW.SAWTOOTHAVALANCHE.COM FOR MORE DETAILED INFORMATION.

SIMILAR AVALANCHE DANGER MAY EXIST AT LOCATIONS OUTSIDE THE
COVERAGE AREA OF THIS OR ANY AVALANCHE CENTER.
